page.title: 02FIVE CROSSES FARM (1)
page.content: This dairy has 150 acres of grazing land, including the "Cave field" where Charlie the Hereford bull spends the summer. Of 87 cows, most are black and white Friesian, each valued at Â£500. The first milking is at 06.00h and takes 3 hours - although each cow needs only 5 minutes to give her milk, much time is used to wash the cow and parlour. Also the cows are fed concentrates in a nut form. At 10.00h a milk tanker takes some milk to Wrexham (for butter or cheese) or to another dairy e.g. Rigby's of Warrington. Several hundred bottles of milk are delivered directly each day in the Frodsham area. These include skimmed, semi-skimmed, long-life, pasturised, sterilized and full cream. Some are bought for resale from other dairies since the farm cannot yet produce them.
